title: Eagles' Dickerson injured in practice, exits on cart
content: Eagles Pro Bowl left guard Landon Dickerson was helped off the field and carted indoors after suffering an apparent right leg injury during the team's open practice Sunday night.

title: Aces' Wilson first with 30-point, 20-rebound game
content: A'ja Wilson had 32 points and 20 rebounds, becoming the first player in WNBA history with 30-plus points and at least 20 rebounds in a game.

title: Rose rallies late, tops Spaun in St. Jude playoff
content: Justin Rose made up a three-shot deficit over the last five holes against hard-luck Tommy Fleetwood, and then made two birdies in a playoff against U.S. Open champion J.J. Spaun to win the FedEx St. Jude Championship on Sunday.

title: Raleigh clubs MLB-best 45th HR in Mariners' win
content: Cal Raleigh hit his major-league-leading 45th home run in a four-run first inning, and Seattle hung on for a 6-3 victory over Tampa Bay on Sunday.

title: Bills delivers Pennsylvania first LLSWS since '78
content: Behind Reagan Bills' two-way heroics, Johnstown, Pennsylvania, defeated Floyds Knobs, Indiana, 1-0 on Sunday to win the state's first Little League Softball World Series since 1978.

title: Olympian Rivera, 17, wins at U.S. championships
content: Hezly Rivera, a 17-year-old Olympic gold medalist, pulled away for a victory at the U.S. gymnastics championships Sunday.

title: With Messi out, Orlando drops Miami to 6th in rout
content: Luis Muriel scored a goal in each half and Mart√≠n Ojeda had a goal and an assist to lead Orlando City to a 4-1 victory over Inter Miami on Sunday night.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: Online predators prey on young athletes using sextortion
content: A Michigan teen was goaded into sharing an intimate photo that scammers threatened to expose unless he paid up.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Donnarumma available for low fee
content: Paris Saint-Germain have made goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma available for a knockdown fee. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins fourth race this season
content: Shane van Gisbergen tied a Cup Series record with his fourth straight road-course victory, blowing out the competition again at Watkins Glen International.

title: üèà Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: üèÜ Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: üèÄ Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: üèà ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üßÇ 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: üëä Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski draws rare Pok√©mon Charizard card after win over Mets
content: The Milwaukee Brewers' vibes were high when they pulled a rare Pok√©mon card after extending their win streak to seven.

title: Dean Burmester wins LIV Chicago in three-way playoff
content: Dean Burmester beat Jon Rahm and Josele Ballester in a three-way playoff Sunday to win LIV Golf Chicago.

title: 'I want it to be my life': Why Patrick Mahomes is much more than a celebrity product endorser
content: For an active athlete of his stature, the Chiefs QB has been unusually involved in his coffee brand's coast-to-coast growth.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: ‚ÄòNuclear sabre-rattling Pak‚Äôs trade‚Äô: India slams Munir‚Äôs remarks; regrets comments made from US
content: India has strongly criticized Pakistan, labeling it an irresponsible nuclear state controlled by its military, following Pak General Asim Munir's threatening remarks. Munir warned of destroying Indian infrastructure affecting water flow and issued a broader nuclear threat. India asserts Pakistan's military dominance undermines democracy and raises concerns about nuclear weapons falling into the wrong hands.

title: 'Vote theft' row splits K'taka Cong: Minister contradicts Rahul; asked to quit
content: Karnataka Minister KN Rajanna criticized his own Congress party for neglecting alleged electoral roll irregularities during their governance, expressing shame over the oversights. Deputy CM DK Shivakumar rebuked Rajanna, disagreeing with his assessment, while speculation arose about Rajanna's potential resignation following his dissenting remarks on vote theft, prompting a meeting with the CM.

title: Air India to suspend nonstop flights between Delhi and Washington from Sept 1
content: Air India will suspend its Delhi-Washington nonstop flights from September 1, 2025. This is due to a shortage of wide-body planes. The airline is revamping its legacy fleet. Passengers can rebook or get full refunds. The retrofit program aims to enhance customer experience. Supply chain issues have delayed the completion to October 2028.

title: Move over Dhoni! Ex-India captain declares who is World No. 1
content: Mohammad Azharuddin praised Syed Kirmani as the world's best wicketkeeper, highlighting his skills against spin and contribution to India's 1983 World Cup victory, at the launch of Kirmani's autobiography. Azharuddin also commended Mohammad Siraj for his outstanding performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy against England, where he emerged as the leading wicket-taker.

title: Microsoft CEO to employees: No longer enough to be software factory, must become‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft is undergoing a significant shift, transitioning from a software manufacturer to an "intelligence engine," according to CEO Satya Nadella. This transformation aims to democratize AI, empowering global users to create their own intelligent tools. Microsoft will focus on building AI systems that enable individuals and organizations to develop customized solutions, redesigning its technology stack to support this new vision.

title: Watch: Chinese vessels collide on South China Sea while chasing boat
content: Tensions escalate in the South China Sea as a Chinese navy vessel collides with a Chinese coast guard ship during a chase of a Philippine patrol boat near Scarborough Shoal. The Philippine coast guard released video footage of the incident, which occurred during a humanitarian mission. Philippine President Marcos affirmed continued presence in the area to assert Manila's sovereign rights.

title: New I-T Bill tabled in Parl: What are the top suggestions being included?
content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman  tabled the revised New Income Tax Bill 2025 in Parliament. This followed the withdrawal of the original bill. The new version incorporates recommendations from a Parliamentary Select Committee.

title: 'Global Sumud Flotilla': Greta Thunberg plans second Gaza aid voyage
content: Greta Thunberg announced a second, larger flotilla mission to deliver aid to Gaza, launching from Spain on August 31st with activists from 44 countries. The "Global Sumud Flotilla" includes multiple ships and aims to break the Israeli blockade, despite previous attempts being intercepted.

title: Trump asks Intel CEO to resign: Former directors call for a new company, say ‚ÄòOnly a dramatic‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Amidst security concerns over CEO Lip-Bu Tan's China ties, four former Intel board members are advocating for a radical restructuring. They propose spinning off Intel's manufacturing arm into an independent entity to bolster America's chipmaking capabilities. This move aims to rival TSMC and address national security needs, especially after Intel received significant CHIPS Act funding.

title: LS passes sports bill; Mandaviya calls it biggest sports reform since Independence
content: India's sports sector is set for a major overhaul with the passage of the National Sports Governance Bill and the National Anti-Doping (Amendment) Bill. Sports Minister Mandaviya hailed the governance bill as the most significant reform since independence, aiming for accountability and transparency in sports federations. The anti-doping bill addresses WADA's concerns, ensuring NADA's independence.

title: Oppn MPs‚Äô march to EC: Akhilesh jumps barricade; Rahul detained ‚Äì Key points
content: Opposition leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, marched to the Election Commission to protest alleged voter fraud and irregularities in Bihar's electoral roll revision. Delhi Police halted the march, leading to dramatic scenes of leaders climbing barricades.

title: Bite marks, beatings: Nanny who brutalised toddler had no training
content: In Noida, a 15-month-old baby was allegedly tortured at a daycare center by a 16-year-old attendant, who bit her thighs and inflicted other injuries. The parents discovered the abuse after noticing bite marks and viewing CCTV footage that revealed the extent of the violence.

title: FASTag annual pass launching Aug 15: Fee, validity & trip limits
content: India's FASTag system is getting an upgrade. The National Highways Authority of India will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on Independence Day. This pass costs Rs 3,000. It allows up to 200 toll crossings or a year of travel for private vehicles. The goal is to reduce congestion and speed up toll transactions.

title: Amid speculation over India future, here‚Äôs when Kohli last played a List A match
content: Speculation surrounds Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's ODI futures as the BCCI contemplates their roles. With the Bangladesh series canceled, their next potential ODI appearance is against Australia in October. A proposal suggests they gain match practice in India A games against Australia A before the series, raising questions about their readiness and future in the format.

title: 'Ensures representation': MHA defends LG's nominations to J&K assembly; submits affidavit to HC
content: The Home Ministry defended the LG's power to nominate assembly members in J&K, citing inclusivity. This came in response to a Congress leader's challenge to the Reorganisation Act. The ministry argued the nominations ensure representation for displaced communities and women. Mehbooba Mufti criticised the move as undemocratic, urging opposition to this precedent.

title: Fans defend Halle Berry after David Justice says he left because she "didn't cook or clean"
content: Halle Berry's fans are defending her after ex-husband David Justice's recent interview, where he claimed he left their marriage due to her not fitting his traditional expectations of a wife. Justice stated he desired a partner who cooked, cleaned, and embodied a strong maternal role, suggesting counseling might have altered their outcome.

title: Nagpur: Man rides 80km with wife‚Äôs body tied to bike after fatal highway crash
content: Following a tragic road accident on the Nagpur-Madhya Pradesh highway, a man was compelled to transport his wife's body home on his motorcycle due to the absence of immediate assistance. The incident occurred near Deolapar, where an unidentified vehicle struck their motorcycle, resulting in the woman's death.

title: ‚ÄòIssue complicated‚Äô: After India tariff, will Trump target China? US VP replies
content: Donald Trump is considering tariffs on China for Russian oil imports. This follows a 25% tariff imposed on India for similar purchases. Vice President J D Vance notes the US-China relationship is complex.

title: NBA hall of famer Allen Iverson‚Äôs emotional message for Carmelo Anthony
content: NBA legend Carmelo Anthony chose Allen Iverson and Dwyane Wade for his Hall of Fame induction. The ceremony is scheduled for September 6, 2025. Iverson expressed his honor on Instagram, recalling their Nuggets days. Anthony will also join NBC Sports and Peacock as a studio analyst. He will share his NBA insights starting in the 2025-26 season.

title: Mahomes gets family, brother Jackson‚Äôs support after preseason benching
content: Patrick Mahomes, despite limited playtime in the preseason game against the Cardinals, demonstrated his readiness and leadership. After a brief appearance that included a touchdown pass, Mahomes shifted to a supportive role, advising teammates and offering insights to the coaching staff. Coach Reid praised Mahomes' leadership, emphasizing his importance to the team's Super Bowl aspirations.

title: Ranya Rao's father K Ramachandra Rao reappointed as DGP; posts in civil rights dept
content: The Karnataka government has reinstated IPS officer Dr. K Ramachandra Rao as DGP after his compulsory leave due to a gold smuggling investigation involving his daughter, Ranya Rao. Ranya was arrested for allegedly smuggling 14.2kg of gold from Dubai.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Bihar: After ‚ÄòDog Babu‚Äô, ‚ÄòCat Kumar‚Äô surfaces; mother's name listed as ‚ÄòCatiya Devi‚Äô
content: Authorities in Bihar's Rohtas district are investigating a bizarre incident where an application for a residential certificate was filed under the name "Cat Kumar," son of "Catty Boss" and "Catiya Devi," complete with a canine's photograph. This incident follows a similar case in Patna‚Äôs Masaurhi block, where a residence certificate was issued to a dog. A formal case has been registered.

title: ODI WC trophy unveiled: Harmanpreet Kaur eyes ICC glory for India
content: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed her team's determination to win the upcoming ODI Women‚Äôs World Cup on home soil, aiming to end India's long wait for an ICC women‚Äôs title. She acknowledged the pressure but highlighted the motivation it provides, drawing inspiration from Yuvraj Singh.

title: FASTag annual pass: Rs 3,000 for 200 trips ‚Äì How to get by Aug 15, 2025
content: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on August 15, 2025, offering private vehicle owners a prepaid plan of 200 toll crossings or one year of validity for Rs 3,000. This initiative aims to streamline toll payments and reduce the need for frequent recharges on national highways and expressways, enhancing the travel experience.

title: 'They will lose to India‚Äô: Ex-cricketer doubts Aus & SA‚Äôs WTC final chances
content: Aakash Chopra suggested that both Australia and South Africa, the finalists of the previous WTC cycle, might face difficulties in reaching the 2027 final. Despite Australia's strong start, their tour of India and an aging bowling attack could hinder their progress. South Africa's challenging away series in the subcontinent also diminish their chances of qualifying, according to Chopra.

title: ‚ÄòThey are financially strong ...‚Äô: Gadkari‚Äôs veiled ‚Äòdadagiri‚Äô jibe amid Trump tariffs
content: Nitin Gadkari indirectly criticised US President Donald Trump's tariff policies, asserting that financial strength and technological advancement shouldn't lead to bullying. He emphasised India's commitment to its culture of global welfare, even with economic growth. Gadkari also highlighted the importance of innovation and research to boost India's economic growth and self-reliance.

title: 'Heart-stopping moment': Congress MP claims 'another aircraft was on same runway'
content: Air India refuted Congress MP KC Venugopal's account of a harrowing flight, stating the diversion to Chennai was due to a suspected technical issue and poor weather, not another aircraft on the runway. Venugopal dismissed Air India's explanation, demanding an inquiry and alleging the airline was lying. BJP's Amit Malviya called the matter serious, highlighting the contradiction and demanding accountability.

title: Harry Gill: 2 vodka cans in one hand, a one-handed screamer in the other - Watch
content: Harry Gill, a 26-year-old pilot, became an overnight sensation in Darwin after making a stunning one-handed catch at the Australia vs. South Africa T20 match. While holding two drinks, Gill snagged a Tim David six, drawing comparisons to Tony Fox's famous 1987 catch. Gill's impressive grab added to the excitement as international cricket returned to Darwin after 17 years.

title: 'Situation grim': SC directs Delhi govt, MCD to start picking up stray dogs
content: The Supreme Court addressed dog bite incidents in Delhi. It directed the Delhi government to remove stray dogs from all areas. The dogs will be kept in shelters and not released back. Shelters with staff for sterilization and immunization must be created. A helpline will be set up within a week for reporting dog bites.

title: ‚ÄòIf these words reach you ...‚Äô: Al Jazeera reporter‚Äôs ‚Äòfinal message‚Äô before being killed
content: Al Jazeera correspondent Anas al-Sharif was killed in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza, along with four other journalists. Prior to his death, al-Sharif posted a video documenting the intense bombardment of Gaza City, leaving behind a final message reflecting on his life and commitment to conveying the truth.

title: F-1 visa chaos: Why Indian student approvals are plummeting before US fall se
content: With less than two weeks before the US fall semester, Indian students face a severe F-1 visa crisis marked by appointment shortages and rising rejections. Student arrivals may drop nearly 70%, disrupting academic plans and US university revenues. Delays stem from stricter screening, suspended interviews, and regulatory changes, pushing many to consider alternative study destinations.

title: Along Ladakh border, China to construct Xinjiang-Tibet rail line
content: China has officially launched the Xinjiang Tibet Railway Co. Ltd., initiating work on the strategic railway line near India's Ladakh border. This project, involving significant investment and traversing challenging terrain, aims to enhance connectivity between Xinjiang and Tibet.

title: Medha Patkar case: SC upholds activist's conviction in VK Saxena's defamation case
content: The Supreme Court upheld Medha Patkar's conviction in a defamation case initiated by VK Saxena. However, the court removed the Rs 1 lakh penalty previously imposed. A Delhi court had earlier issued a warrant against Patkar for not complying with the sentencing order. The Delhi High Court had also supported Patkar's conviction, stating that her challenge relied on minor technicalities.

title: 'Came to celebrate birthday': Knife attack at Puducherry bar leaves 1 student dead
content: Moshik Shanmugasundaram, a 21-year-old college student, was fatally stabbed at a Puducherry restobar following a late-night birthday celebration with friends. An argument with the restobar owner and staff over closing time escalated into a brawl.

title: ‚ÄòProbably could‚Äôve made it‚Äô: David Justice reflects on Halle Berry split
content: David Justice reflected on his marriage with Halle Berry, citing youth, distance, and traditional expectations as contributing factors to their divorce. He expressed regret over not seeking counseling, believing it could have helped them navigate their challenges. Justice's remarks about Berry's domestic skills sparked online debate, highlighting evolving views on gender roles in marriage.

title: Vote 'chori' row: EC repeats 'sign declaration or apologise' dare; adds ‚ÄòRahul still has time‚Äô
content: The Election Commission has pressed Rahul Gandhi to substantiate his claims of "vote theft" in Karnataka and Haryana, demanding either a formal declaration supporting his allegations or a public apology. The Karnataka CEO has requested documents related to Gandhi's assertion that a voter cast two ballots, citing discrepancies in ECI records.

title: 'You won't be hitting ‚Ä¶': Akash Deep on Duckett send-off, why Oval fifty tops Edgbaston 10-for
content: Akash Deep reflected on India's drawn series in England, highlighting his experiences and interactions, including a verbal exchange with Ben Duckett. He valued his half-century more than a ten-wicket haul and dedicated his performance to his sister battling cancer. Akash Deep also praised Mohammed Siraj's fitness and mental fortitude during the series.

title: Vote ‚Äòchori‚Äô clamour grows in Karnataka: It‚Äôs CM‚Äôs aides vs DKS supporters
content: Cracks appear within Karnataka's Congress as minister KN Rajanna publicly contradicted Rahul Gandhi's claims of vote theft in the Lok Sabha elections, suggesting the party failed to address voter list irregularities during its own governance. This sparked a backlash from Deputy CM DK Shivakumar's supporters, accusing Rajanna of undermining the party.

title: PM Modi‚Äôs ‚ÄòKosi‚Äô jibe at opposition at MP flats launch in Delhi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated 184 new flats for Members of Parliament in New Delhi, emphasizing modern amenities and green technology. The complex, designed for self-sufficiency and sustainability, incorporates features like renewable power generation and improved waste management.

title: Where is Dhankhar? Sanjay Raut writes to Amit Shah; asks 'what happened to VP?'
content: Amidst growing concerns, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has urged Home Minister Amit Shah to disclose the whereabouts and health status of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, who resigned unexpectedly in July. Raut's letter highlights the lack of information since Dhankhar's resignation, fueling rumors of confinement and prompting calls for transparency.

title: Aamir Khan, family respond to Faissal‚Äôs remarks: ‚ÄòNot the first time‚Äô
content: Aamir Khan's family addresses Faissal Khan's claims. The family denies mistreatment. They cite concern for Faissal's well-being. Decisions were made with medical advice. Faissal alleges confinement. He says he was wrongly labeled mentally unstable. He claims Aamir held him against his will. Legal battles and mental health evaluations occurred. The family requests privacy.

title: ICMAI CMA toppers: Hans Amresh secures first rank in Finals- check top 10 here
content: The Institute of Cost Accountants of India (ICMAI) has announced the CMA June 2025 Intermediate and Final exam toppers, with Hans Amresh from Surat securing the first rank. The top 10 list features candidates from cities including Mumbai, Jaipur, Faridabad, and Bangalore, reflecting wide geographic representation and notable female participation in this year‚Äôs merit rankings.

title: Noida daycare horror: Attendant slaps, punches, bites, throws toddler; owner watched
content: In Noida's Sector 137, a 15-month-old was allegedly assaulted at 'Blippi' daycare. The attendant, Sonali, is accused of slapping, hitting, and biting the toddler. The owner, Charu, allegedly watched without intervening. The mother discovered bite marks and reviewed CCTV footage, leading to a police complaint.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 3 Reasons Trump Is Growing Soft Towards China - While He Attacks India
content: Curiously, Trump's stance on China, the US's primary rival in all terms - economic, military, or ideological -now seems to be oriented towards achieving a deal rather than punishing it.

title: 2.17 Lakh Fake Currency Notes Detected In Financial Year 2024-25: Government
content: As many as 2.17 lakh pieces of fake notes of various denominations were detected during 2024-25 compared to 2.23 lakh such notes in the previous year, Parliament was informed on Monday.

title: From Obama To Trump: How US-India Trade Ties Went From Growth To Tensions
content: On August 1, 2025, the United States President Donald Trump announced a 25% tariff on Indian imports, a move that was followed by an additional 25% tariff, escalating trade tensions between the two countries.

title: Free Bus Travel For Girls, Women, Transgender In Andhra From August 15
content: All girls, women, and transgender persons holding Andhra Pradesh domicile are eligible for free bus travel under the 'Stree Shakti'  scheme, to be launched statewide on August 15.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 16 Live Updates: Proceedings Of Lok Sabha Adjourned, Rajya Sabha Resumes
content: ¬†The proceedings of Lok Sabha has been adjourned till 4:00 pm. Meanwhile, the proceedings of Rajya Sabha has resumed.¬†

title: UP Assembly Holds Artificial Intelligence Training Session For MLAs
content: A special training session on 'Empowering Public Representatives: Strengthening Communication and Governance through Artificial Intelligence (AI)' was organised for MLAs in the Uttar Pradesh State Assembly.

title: Tripura Jawan Poisons 1-Year-Old Daughter. He Reportedly Wanted A Son
content: A Tripura State Rifles (TSR) personnel has been accused of poisoning his one-year-old daughter, reportedly because he wanted a son.

title: Tesla To Expand Super Charging Network In Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru
content: American electric vehicle maker Tesla plans to expand its super charging network in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai and Bangalore as it plans to start deliveries in India by September, a senior company official said on Monday.

title: Supreme Court Sets Aside Limit On Women's Appointment To Army's Legal Arm
content: The Supreme Court said restricting the seats of women in the Army's Judge Advocate General (JAG) branch is violative of the right to equality.

title: NASA To Build Nuclear Reactor On Moon By 2030, Here's Why
content: The first space race was about flags and footprints. Now, decades later, landing on the Moon is old news. The new race is to build there, and doing so hinges on power.

title: Video: Akhilesh Yadav Jumps Police Barricade During Opposition Protest
content: As police tried to stop Opposition leaders from marching to the Election Commission of India amid allegations of "vote fraud", Samajwadi Party chief and Kannauj MP Akhilesh Yadav was seen jumping over a barricade

title: Supreme Court Confirms Medha Patkar's Conviction In Defamation Case
content: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to interfere with the conviction of activist Medha Patkar in the 2021 criminal defamation case filed against her by V.K. Saxena -- the now Lieutenant Governor of Delhi.

title: Kerala Woman Dies By Suicide, Accuses Lover Of Harassment, Conversion
content: Death note, recovered by police, accuses Ramees of physical and mental harassment, locking her in a room, and forcing her to convert before marriage.

title: Passengers Stranded At Raipur Runway As Air India Flight Door Fails To Open
content: A technical snag in an Air India flight arriving from Delhi led to a tense hour-long delay at Raipur airport, leaving around 160 passengers, including a sitting MLA, stranded inside the aircraft with no immediate explanation.

title: "We'll Take Half World Down With Us": Pak Army Chief Asim Munir's Nuclear Threat In US
content: Pakistan's Army Chief Asim Munir has openly warned of a "nuclear war" from American soil. Addressing an event in Tampa, Florida, Pakistan's de facto military ruler threatened to take down "half the world" if his country faced an existential threat in

title: Sikkim's Non-Working Mothers To Get Rs 40,000 A Year, Announces Chief Minister Prem Singh Tamang
content: Under the newly-launched initiative, all non-working women will receive a grant of Rs 40,000 every year.

title: "These Animal Activists...": Big Supreme Court Order On Stray Dog Menace
content: The bench of Justice JB Pardiwala and Justice R Mahadevan were hearing the matter after taking note of a news report on the rising incidents of rabies deaths following stray dog attacks.

title: What Are Animal Birth Control Rules That Top Court Called "Absurd" Over Stray Dog "Menace"
content: The Supreme Court on Monday directed the Delhi government and civic bodies to start picking up stray dogs from all localities at the earliest and keep them at dog shelters.

title: GPT-5 Is Free For All: What's New And How To Get It
content: Designed on the GPT 4 model, GPT-5 offers detailed and thoughtful answers by analysing complex tasks such as coding, science questions, information synthesis, or financial analysis. It's expected to provide more accurate and faster responses.

title: NBA's new financial rules threaten dynasties: 'Harder choices' for top teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . since the Warriors won back-to-back titles in 2017 and 2018, the NBA has seen seven different champions hoist the Larry O'Brien Trophy . there have been 11 different finalists in each of the past six postseasons .

title: 'Fight for One Man, One Vote': Rahul after stir near EC HQ; refuses to sign oath
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Defensive frailties dog Liverpool, but new signings show quality
content: Crystal Palace drew 2-2 with a 3-2 penalty shootout win at wembley on sunday . the win was the second in a matter of months for the premier league champions . it was their opponents' second win of the season after 2-1 defeat to Newcastle united .

title: üèà Ultimate Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet
content: the ultimate ESPN fantasy football cheat sheet is a curated rundown of all the names we've been talking about this preseason . if you want to read more about sleepers, busts, rookies, backups, value picks and more, the analysis is available for you to pore through .

title: Ganne cruises to win 1st U.S. Women's Amateur
content: megha Ganne wins three straight holes against mistake-prone Brooke Biermann . Ganne is 4 down with seven holes to play in the semifinals against Ella Scaysbrook . she has been chasing a USGA title for nearly a decade .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Tyler Shough's debut a mixed bag for Saints
content: the 2025 preseason kicked off Thursday and continued through Sunday . several rookies played their first snaps, whether they were rookies or offseason acquisitions . quarterback jamaree Caldwell has shown why the Chargers selected him .

title: How will Yankees manage busy bullpen?
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the game is the rubber game of the weekend between the St. Louis Cardinals and the Chicago Cubs . a left oblique strain was scratched from today's start and was placed on the 15-day IL with a . left strain .

title: Kerala has set a model for the country in Ayurveda treatment, says Health Minister
content: Veena George inaugurates newly constructed women‚Äôs hostel building and open-air stage at Government Ayurveda College, Pariyaram, Kannur

title: Karnataka Minister K.N. Rajanna asked to resign: CMO sources
content: The minister had sparked a row by saying that irregularities in the electoral rolls occurred while the Congress was in power

title: India sees normal monsoon rainfall; some States drenched, others parched
content: Between June 1 and August 10, the country recorded 539 mm of rain against a normal of 535.6 mm, about 1% above the long-period average

title: US tariff hike will hit Kerala‚Äôs exports hard, State to study crisis in depth: CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi points out that US is the second largest importer of agricultural products from Kerala, accounting for more than 20% of State‚Äôs exports of cashew nut, rice, vegetables, processed fruits and cereal flours

title: Giani Harpreet Singh elected president of SAD breakaway faction
content: The Akal Takht-appointed committee held the delegate session of the breakaway group of the SAD at Gurdwara Burj Akali Phoola Singh in Amritsar.

title: Fire breaks out in basement of Navi Mumbai hospital; all patients safely evacuated
content: According to fire service officials, the incident was reported at 12 noon on August 11 in a medical facility in Sector 6.

title: Uber launches India‚Äôs first dedicated Uber Black pickup zone at Bengaluru airport
content: The initiative, launched on August 11, is aimed at offering a seamless transition between air and ground travel, according to Uber

title: More than 40 arrests made under anti-poaching exercise in Assam, says video shared by CM Himanta Biswa Sharma
content: ‚ÄúPoachers have been chased, using all available resources, from on-ground to digital intelligence,‚Äù Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Asim Munir‚Äôs remarks ‚Äòreinforce well-held doubts‚Äô about Pakistan‚Äôs nuclear command, says India
content: ‚ÄúThe international community can draw its own conclusions on the irresponsibility inherent in such remarks, which also reinforce the well-held doubts about the integrity of nuclear command and control in a state where the military is hand-in-glove with terrorist groups,‚Äù the Ministry of External Affairs said

title: Watch: Chennai sanitation workers protest privatisation, demand permanent jobs
content: For decades, Chennai‚Äôs conservancy workers have kept the city clean, often without recognition or job security. Now, facing job losses due to a sweeping privatisation move by the Greater Chennai Corporation, nearly 2,000 workers are rising in protest, demanding permanency. As garbage piles up and political pressure mounts, the city is at a crossroads in its battle over dignity, livelihood, and public sanitation.

title: Third edition of Vaidya Vishwakosha, encyclopaedia on medicine in Kannada, released in Kalaburagi
content: Minister for Medical Education Dr. Sharan Prakash Patil, who released the 875-page volume, described the work as an extraordinary and challenging achievement

title: Air India flight diverted to Chennai: DGCA rejects MP Venugopal‚Äôs claim
content: DGCA responds with a detailed statement rejecting Congress MP K.C. Venugopal‚Äôs claim that the Air India plane‚Äôs landing was aborted as ‚Äòanother aircraft was on the runway‚Äô

title: Kerala govt clears boat purchase for Haritha Karma Sena in Kainakary to collect non-biodegradable waste
content: In eight of the 15 wards in the panchayat, waterways are the primary means of travel. At present, waste collection is carried out using a rented boat, which costs ‚Çπ27,000 per month

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Sitharaman introduces modified Income Tax bill in Lok Sabha
content: The Select Committee, chaired by Baijayant Panda, had suggested a host of changes in the Income-tax Bill, 2025, which was introduced in the Lok Sabha on February 13

title: Opposition protests well thought out strategy to create anarchy, instability: BJP
content: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan termed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs allegation of ‚Äúvote theft‚Äù against the ruling BJP and the Election Commission a ‚Äúlie‚Äù and said the Congress has been resorting to such tactics as it has no other issues to raise

title: Karnataka witnessed five-fold jump in GST tax evasion at ‚Çπ39,577 cr in FY25, Lok Sabha informed
content: In a written reply in the Lok Sabha, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said ‚ÄúCentral GST authorities have not issued any notices based on UPI transaction‚Äù.

title: Sun TV share dispute: ‚ÄòDayanidhi Maran‚Äôs legal notice against brother Kalanithi withdrawn, issues resolved‚Äô
content: In June, a truce was called and a mediation between the Maran brothers took place in the presence of key members of the DMK family, including Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

title: India on U.K.‚Äôs ‚ÄòDeport Now Appeal Later‚Äô expanded list for foreign criminals
content: India will be added along with Angola, Australia, Botswana, Brunei, Bulgaria, Canada, Guyana, Indonesia, Kenya, Latvia, Lebanon, Malaysia, Uganda and Zambia

title: Rajasthan HC extends Asaram's interim bail
content: The relief came after a recent extension of his interim bail by Gujarat High court in a similar case till August 21

title: Ranya Rao case: DGP Ramachandra Rao re-appointed
content: Ramachandra Rao has been posted as Director General of Police, Directorate of Civil Rights Enforcement

title: Kerala‚Äôs public health sector under attack from corporate hospital lobbies, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi says multinational companies are making large-scale investments in private healthcare with the primary aim of maximising returns

title: No proposal under consideration for restoration of Old Pension Scheme: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The Centre had moved away from OPS due to its unsustainable fiscal liability on the government exchequer, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said in a reply in the Lok Sabha.

title: Kerala young woman‚Äôs death takes a twist; friend arrested for abetment to suicide, sexual abuse
content: Initially, Kothamangalam police registered a case of unnatural death. However, police have stumbled up on a suicide note, reportedly written by the deceased

title: Google vs CCI: What the Android antitrust case means for India‚Äôs digital ecosystem
content: The case raises fundamental questions about how much control a dominant platform like Android should have over the devices and services it supports, and to what extent regulators can intervene in the name of competition.

title: Minor girl in Odisha dies after self-immolation
content: She was first rushed to a private hospital and later referred to Veer Surendra Sai Institute of Medical Sciences and Research, Burla. The girl died during treatment at Burla

title: ‚Çπ100-crore defamation suit filed by M.S. Dhoni | Madras High Court orders commencement of trial
content: Justice C.V. Karthikeyan appoints an advocate commissioner to record the evidence of the cricketer in Chennai between October 20 and December 10, 2025

title: A.P. Home Minister Anitha directs officials to be on alert following IMD‚Äôs heavy rain forecast
content: Ms. Anitha directed the Collectors, Superintendents of Police and the A.P. State Disaster Management Authority officials to be alert and take steps to prevent human loss.

title: Rahul Gandhi demands clean, pure voter list
content: Rahul Gandhi demands clean voter list, accuses ECI of silence on fake votes, detained during protest march

title: A.P. Governor to launch Red Cross‚Äôs campaign against against single-use plastics in Guntur on August 12
content: Governor S. Abdul Nazeer will formally launch the initiative on Tuesday, with 70 schools receiving the first batch of cloth bags on a pilot basis.

title: Supreme Court strikes down Army‚Äôs policy restricting women officers‚Äô appointment to Judge Advocate General posts
content: ‚ÄúThe Executive cannot restrict numbers and/or make reservation for male officers under the guise of induction by way of policy or administrative instructions,‚Äù Supreme Court observed

title: Chennai Corporation conservancy workers‚Äô protest: Madras High Court to hear writ petition on August 13
content: Justice K. Surender adjourns the matter after Advocate General P.S. Raman says he intends to file a fresh counter affidavit on behalf of the Corporation Commissioner

title: Minister Kondapalli urges entrepreneurs to be part of A.P. govt.‚Äôs P-4 programme
content: Nearly 20 lakh marginalised families would be covered under the A.P. govt.‚Äôs P4 programme and they would be called as golden families under the programme, says Minister Kondapalli Srinivas

title: Tourist‚Äôs misadventure with elephant in Bandipur turns into heart-stopping moment on camera
content: This incident has brought into focus the recurring problem of tourists disregarding safety advisories to venture close to wild animals in forests

title: Kerala Governor‚Äôs directive on ‚ÄòPartition Horror Day‚Äô sparks political controversy
content: Official email from Kerala Raj Bhavan instructed universities to organise seminars and commemorative events, including street plays and dramas highlighting ‚Äòthe trauma of India‚Äôs partition‚Äô

title: ‚ÄòVoter fraud‚Äô allegations: Surjewala accuses Election Commission for ‚Äòlame duck‚Äô excuses
content: Randeep Singh Surjewala‚Äôs remarks came after the Haryana Chief Electoral Officer asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to furnish documents within 10 days in support of his claims about anomalies in electoral rolls in the 2024 State Assembly polls

title: Suneetha Narreddy writes open letter seeking reopening of probe into her father‚Äôs murder
content: Suneetha Narreddy said her father Vivekananda Reddy was brutally murdered and the perpetrators of the crime were caught but the conspirators remained untouched

title: Opposition takes out protest march against SIR, ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô; says ECI can‚Äôt be ‚Äòchurao aayog‚Äô
content: Wearing white caps with a red cross on the words ‚ÄòSIR‚Äô and ‚Äúvote chori‚Äù, the protesting MPs raised slogans against the SIR exercise in Bihar while carrying placards and banners

title: Supreme Court confirms Medha Patkar‚Äôs conviction in criminal defamation case by Delhi L-G Saxena
content: A Bench of Justices however set aside an order directing Ms. Patkar, represented by senior advocate Sanjay Parikh and advocate Abhimanue Shreshta, to pay ‚Çπ1 lakh in compensation

title: Both Houses adjourned till 2 p.m. as Opposition firm on discussion on Bihar SIR
content: Opposition has been demanding a discussion on the SIR exercise initiated by the Election Commission ahead of the Bihar assembly elections due later this year

title: Criminal killed in police firing in Jharkhand
content: According to police, Surya Narayan Hansda alias Surya Hansda, was wanted in several criminal cases in Jharkhand's Godda and Sahibganj districts

title: Samajwadi Party MLAs protest on Assembly premises ahead of Uttar Pradesh Monsoon session
content: Carrying banners, posters and placards in their hands, the MLAs of Samajwadi Party gathered near the statue of Chaudhary Charan Singh on the Assembly premises and raised anti-government slogans

title: BJP has turned ECI into its ‚Äòpoll-rigging machinery‚Äô, alleges T.N. CM Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin alleged that what happened in Bengaluru‚Äôs Mahadevapura was ‚Äúnot an administrative lapse,‚Äù but ‚Äúa calculated conspiracy to steal the people‚Äôs mandate.‚Äù

title: Noida Police bust fake international police, crime investigation bureau office; 6 arrested
content: The Police said that West Bengal residents, pretending to be government officials, influenced locals with office logos and recently rented an office in Central Noida

title: Mamata pays tribute to Khudiram Bose, slams makers of Kesari Chapter 2 film
content: Ms. Banerjee claimed that the film wKesari Chapter 2, wrongly named Khudiram Bose as "Khudiram Singh" and Barindra Kumar Ghosh as "Birendra Kumar" from Amritsar.

title: Supreme Court lists petition seeking panel for ‚Äòreturn‚Äô of captive elephants at Vantara
content: The petitioner has sought the constitution of a monitoring committee to ensure the return of the captive elephants to its owners and to ‚Äúrescue all wild animals, birds from Vantara and free them into the wild‚Äù

title: Low-pressure system over Bay of Bengal may revive rains in Kerala after subdued phase
content: At present, break-monsoon conditions prevail, with monsoon trough shifting its position to north of its original position

title: Yemen‚Äôs leader praises ‚Äòdeep-rooted friendship‚Äô, ‚Äòcooperative‚Äô ties with India
content: Al-Alimi, who heads the Presidential Leadership Council of Yemen, met with the Indian Ambassador Suhel Khan on August 10, 2025 in Riyadh

title: Vedan rape case: Police issue lookout notice against rapper
content: Circular in connection with the case based on a doctor‚Äôs complaint that Vedan allegedly abused her sexually on the promise of marriage

title: Block pirated versions of Rajinikanth‚Äôs ‚ÄòCoolie‚Äô on websites, Madras High Court directs internet service providers including BSNL, Airtel

title: Opposition march to ECI updates: INDIA bloc MPs take out protest march against SIR, ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô
content: Later today, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge will host the MPs for a dinner meeting to formulate a common strategy on the issue of the alleged poll fraud

title: Pakistan Army chief Munir repeats anti-India rhetoric in U.S. with ‚Äòjugular vein‚Äô remark
content: Pakistani army chief  Asim Munir made the comments while addressing the Pakistani diaspora in Tampa, Florida.

title: Security operation to neutralise terrorists enters second day in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar
content: The search operation in the forest area started on August 10, following intelligence input about the presence of two most wanted Hizbul Mujahideen terrorists

title: Hyderabad Rain | Forecast prompts push for staggered timings in tech hub
content: While advisories have been issued in the past, officials say the real challenge lies in corporate compliance

title: India monsoon LIVE: India sees normal monsoon rainfall; some States drenched, others parched, says IMD
content: Of the 36 States and Union Territories for which the IMD provides figures, 25 are in the ‚Äúnormal‚Äù category, five are ‚Äúdeficient‚Äù, five are in the ‚Äúexcess‚Äù category and one (Ladakh) is in the ‚Äúlarge excess‚Äù category

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 16 highlights: Lok Sabha passes modified Income Tax Bill, 2025
content: Lok Sabha also passed the National Sports Governance Bill and the National Anti-Doping (Amendment) Bill

title: Measures sought to restore Marine Drive to its past glory
content: Appointment of a nodal officer to coordinate with different agencies to ensure the upkeep of the walkway, steps to prevent waste dumping into mangroves and backwaters, and adequate number of toilets and garbage bins among key demands

title: Employees‚Äô union urges govt. to drop move to allot RTC lands to LuLu Group for building shopping mall

title: Bihar CM transfers ‚Çπ1,247.34 crore to pensioners

title: Ramadoss vs. Anbumani ‚Äî the father-son feud in Pattali Makkal Katchi | Explained
content: Pattali Makkal Katchi‚Äôs ongoing leadership fight between the party‚Äôs founder S. Ramadoss and his son-party president Anbumani Ramadoss has created a split within PMK, causing conflict ‚Äì right from senior leadership down to the grassroots.

content: The delegation alleged that the officers had been filing false cases, making illegal detentions, and protecting TDP activists accused of attacking YSRCP cadre

content: Government undermining democracy and engaging in anarchic politics in Pulivendula and Ontimitta, he says

title: Fairly widespread rain likely in North and South Coastal A.P. from August 13

title: Rajgopal Reddy‚Äôs issue not discussed at Congress party‚Äôs disciplinary committee meeting

Nagamohan Das Commission report on internal reservation to a Cabinet sub-committee to study it, several Dalit organisations, under the banner of Federation for Social Justice for Scheduled Castes, will start their indefinite protest from Monday morning, seeking immediate implementation of the report.
